experiment.name: Transcription profiling of diurnal gene expression in Arabidopsis thaliana Col-0 rosette leaves

description.text: How do the transcript levels of leaf-expressed genes change in a normal day-night cycle? The interest is in genes that are regulated by the circadian clock and the diurnal component (i.e. light, metabolite changes). Plants were grown on soil in a 12/12 h light/dark rythm at 20Â°C day and night. 5 weeks after germination the rosettes of the non-flowering plants were harvested, 15 plants per sample. Plants were harvested at 6 timepoints every 4 hours beginning with the end of the night (still in darkness).

bibliography.authors: Oliver E Blasing,Yves Gibon,Manuela Gunther,Melanie Hohne,Rosa Morcuende,Daniel Osuna,Oliver Thimm,Bjorn Usadel,Wolf-Rudiger Scheible,Mark Stitt
bibliography.title: Sugars and circadian regulation make major contributions to the global regulation of diurnal gene expression in Arabidopsis.
